opener.title: How Water Flows Through California
opener.subtitle: Why California’s Water Is Unique
opener.p1: All living things need water to survive.
opener.p2: However, in California, most of our water falls far from where most people live, work and farm.
opener.throughline: To address this mismatch, we have transformed the way water moves across our state.

precipitation.title: Where and When Water Falls
precipitation.p1: Nearly all of California’s rain and snow falls in winter — a short period lasting less than 100 days.
precipitation.p2: The vast majority of precipitation consistently falls in the northern part of the state.
